name: 專業筆譯（中譯英）
description: This course is a practice-based training course designed to help students learn professional skills necessary for translating Chinese texts dealing with finance, economics, and law into English. Students’ self-study of relevant industries and fields through weekly online reference materials provided will lead to the acquisition of key terminology and background knowledge.
goals: Students will be required to complete weekly translation exercise of about 700~1000 Chinese characters long. At least 14 exercises during the term
Students will sit for their mid-term and final exams to gauge progress and to help them develop translation competence under time pressure.
Students will be required to compile a bilingual glossary of terms based on the assigned exercises, to be submitted after mid-terms and the end of the semester.

The course design will help students acquire professional translation skills necessary for handling documents/articles on finance, economics, and law. They shall also learn relevant terminology and conceptual background.
syllabus:
This is a practice-based training course designed to help students learn professional skills necessary for translating Chinese texts dealing with science and technology into English. In this semester, students’ self-study of relevant industries and fields through weekly online reference materials will lead to the acquisition of key terminology and background knowledge, in addition to learning translation skills for handling relevant professional texts.

Course Objectives

To help students learn the techniques for translating "culture, history and art " texts into Chinese/English

Classes will be conducted as follows:  
(1) A weekly translation exercise of about 800-1000 words/characters long. At least 13 exercises during the term.  
(2) Source-language texts will include select articles on science and technology topics. Handouts or relevant online links will be given to students for prior reading before doing their translation assignments.(3) Weekly translation projects submitted by students will be discussed in class, including analysis of mistranslations, omissions, corrections and improvements.  
(4) Emphasis of student-work analysis: accuracy, grammar, diction, vocabulary, tone, language register, style and format.  
(5) Students will be regularly assigned to study and comment on the work of their classmates as a means to learn others’ adopted techniques, as well as consider their pros and cons, in comparison with their own work.  
(6) As a way to develop speed, students will at times be required to do translation of short passages on-site, to be followed by a review of their work.  
(8) Students will sit for their mid-term and final exams.

**Weekly Schedule**

Introduction: Global Warming and Greenhouse Effect

Typhoons and Cyclones

El Nino

Earthquake Prediction

Oil Spill Clean-up

Disease Control

Gene Therapy

Stem Cells

Essential Plant Chemicals

3D Printing

LCDs

Satellite Systems

Space Technology

Modern Archaeology

Semiconductors

methodologies.note: Students may be assigned to work in pairs
